misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of MD2 as a cryptographic hash algorithm is considered broken and should not be used. It has been shown to be vulnerable to collision attacks and should be replaced with a stronger algorithm such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.
recommendation: Replace the use of MD2 with a stronger algorithm such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.
